passage: Flat tax systems impose a constant tax rate on all individuals, regardless of income. Proponents argue that flat taxes are fairer, as they treat everyone equally, while opponents claim that they disproportionately benefit the wealthy by reducing the tax burden on higher-income individuals.
question: Which finding, if true, would most directly challenge the proponents' argument that flat taxes are fairer?

choices.A: Flat tax systems have been successfully implemented in several countries.
choices.B: Countries implementing flat tax have witnessed an increase in overall tax revenues.
choices.C: Some high-income individuals have expressed support for the flat tax system.
choices.D: Lower-income individuals end up paying a higher percentage of their income on basic necessities under a flat tax system.

explanation: D: 'Lower-income individuals end up paying a higher percentage of their income on basic necessities under a flat tax system.' is the correct answer because it directly challenges the fairness argument by showing that the flat tax system may disproportionately burden lower-income individuals.
distractor_explanation: 'Countries implementing flat tax have witnessed an increase in overall tax revenues.' is incorrect because it does not address the fairness argument.
'Some high-income individuals have expressed support for the flat tax system.' is incorrect because individual support does not necessarily indicate fairness.
'Flat tax systems have been successfully implemented in several countries.' is incorrect because successful implementation does not necessarily imply fairness.
